column8:
This design admires Bristol born Paul Dirac. Dirac is regarded as one of the world's greatest physicists. He is one of the co-founders of the quantum theory (along with Einstein, Bohr, Born, Heisenberg, Pauli, Schrodinger and others).

 

His provided tremendous contributions to quantum theory. He founded quantum field theory (with Dirac equation), which predicted the existence of antimatter & matter-antimatter annihilation. Dirac was also the first to formulate quantum electrodynamics.

 

Other contributions he made were the Dirac sea (used in my design)??, Dirac comb??, Dirac delta function??, Fermi–Dirac statistics??, Dirac spinor??, Dirac measure??, Bra-ket notation, ??Dirac adjoint??, Dirac large numbers hypothesis??, Dirac fermion??, Dirac string??, Dirac algebra, ??Dirac operator, ??Abraham-Lorentz-Dirac force??, Dirac bracket, ??Fermi–Dirac integral, ??Negative probability??, Dirac Picture, ??Dirac-Coulomb-Breit Equation!

 

The design uses graphics which to me, symbolise particles & waves with the central sphere showing a graphic that seems both complicated and mysterious, which is exactly what quantum theory is to me, I hope you like it!
column21: This design admires Bristol born Paul Dirac. Dirac is regarded as one of the world's greatest physicists. He is one of the co-founders of the quantum theory (along with Einstein, Bohr, Born, Heisenberg, Pauli, Schrodinger and others). Admire them with this special t shirt from weadmire.net.

column8:
Anyone who watched European or International football in the 1990’s will be familiar with Oleg Romantsev, if not by name then as the serious looking, chain smoking figure who managed the Russian national side and Spartak Moscow.

Despite the glory and success he achieved with Spartak, he rarely smiled or celebrated if his side scored.

In a massive understatement one former player said “he’s hard to please”, after his team had once won a title deciding match 5-0 he forbade the celebrating players to drink champagne for almost letting in a goal at the end.

One of the last great soviet era football managers, he is now retired and lives [one hopes happily!] in the Russian countryside
column21: Anyone who watched European or International football in the 1990’s will be familiar with Oleg Romantsev, if not by name then as the serious looking, chain smoking figure who managed the Russian national side and Spartak Moscow. Show your admiration for him with this t shirt from weadmire.net.

column8: Friedrich Nietzsche was a German 19th Century philosopher who wrote important texts on topics such as religion, morality, philosophy and science and has influenced writers, poets, artists, musicians, psychologists to the present day.  His most notable work was challenging the foundations of Christianity and morality believing in the realities of the world we live in rather than the life beyond.  The design is an image of a dissected Nietzsche with topics that he has written about and notable quotes that many would recognise even if they are not familiar with his work.
column21: A t shirt admiring Nietzsche, the famous philosopher and all-round genius. From weadmire.net.

column8:
Nietzsche
The famnous/infamous words of Friedrich Nietzsche, 'God is Dead' have always meant so much more to me than their original religious context. Essentially, he was saying that we have created God, but there is no such being, so we are free to do as we will. He even said that we are the ultimate murderers, and asked what we can do to attone for this most awful crime. The answer is obvious: it is up to us to look after each other, to be the Gods we hope for.
The designs take that idea and apply it to all man-made heroes, guardians and icons of protection. For me superheroes are very powerful, instantly recognisable images, and to kill them (as much as I love them) in a way, is to say that we must be our own superheroes, which I think is ultimately a very positive message.
column21: A t shirt admiring Nietzsche, the famous philosopher and all-round genius. From weadmire.net.
